definition: full to the point of bursting/(coll.) at most
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support
fullness for the bold, famine for the timid (idiom)
pinyin: cheng1 si3 dan3 da4 de5 , e4 si3 dan3 xiao3 de5
containing_words.word: 撑死胆大的，饿死胆小的

sentences.english: Many People have played themself to death, or eaten themself to death. Nobody has ever thought himself to death.
sentences.chinese: 很多人玩死或撑死，但从来没有人思考而死。

sentences.english: Sorry. The subscriber you dialed was stuffed to death.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，您拔叫的用户已撑死。

sentences.english: If ghrelin were all there was to it, we and the rats would eat ourselves to death.
sentences.chinese: 如果就光有它，我们还有那些老鼠们会吃到撑死。

sentences.english: She shows loving care for me and hastens to add more food on my plate until I eat myself sick.
sentences.chinese: 夫人关怀备至，赶紧在盘子里加食，直到我吃得撑死。

definition: to starve to death/to be very hungry
to break even/to get one's money's worth
to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
